intro: Helianthella nudicaulis, commonly known as the narrowleaf paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy, bright orange to red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Helianthella nudicaulis is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators including hummingbirds and bees.
